Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2013 07:27PM jessicaaa wrote: the edges of the fibroadenoma werent smooth and rounded as they should be. it is sort of an odd shape, as my second ultrasound confirmed. but the doctor says in 6 months come for another ultrasound/mammogram. the first labeling of a birads 5 still stumps me. thats why im considering seeing another doctor just to ease my mind.

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2013 02:03PM jessicaaa wrote: thank you i will definitely call another doctor. This new doctor thinks im too young, i agree (im only 21) but breast cancer runs in the family
Posts.Title: Should i be more assertive? jessicaaa LiLi1964

Posts.Content: jessicaaa wrote: hi about 2 months ago my ob/gyn found a lump and sent me to get an ultrasound. the results came back and they said they had a level 5 suspicion (highest you can have) about the lump which they said was a fibroadenoma. they ordered for me to have a core needle biopsy. the only problem is that i have moved right as that was going on. I just yesterday went to a new doctor who said that he does not suggest a biopsy. He did however have me take another ultrasound. Should i be more assertive and push for a biopsy or should i get a second opinion?? so many emotions going through my mind. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Should i be more assertive? jessicaaa LiLi1964

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2013 05:43PM jessicaaa wrote: why would one doctor classify it birad 5 and the other say it was not a big deal? my newest doctor told me that my old doctor probably did it for legal purposes so i don't try to sue. i forgot to mention is it about 2.4 cm does size make a difference?
Posts.Title: Should i be more assertive? jessicaaa LiLi1964

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2013 10:01PM jessicaaa wrote: I have not had a mammogram but both ultrasounds read the same. 2.4 cm fibroadenoma with edges not quite rounded. This is why my first doctor wanted to biopsy it. The second doctor didnt even think twice. right off the bat he came in, didnt even feel it and said i was too young. he sent me for the second ultra sound and a radiologist was there with me saying that although the edges are not rounded he said hes siding with the doctor not to biopsy because of my age
Posts.Title: Should i be more assertive? jessicaaa LiLi1964

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2013 04:11PM jessicaaa wrote: hi everyone. sorry i took so long to reply! i was caught up with moving and then dreaded pneumonia came upon me! im doing better now. i forgot that i was talking to people who knew what they were talking about. So ill be a little more specific. I found the lump and reported it to my OBGYN. he referred me to an ultrasound at a breast center. The breast center rated it BIRADS 5. after talking to my OBGYN about my options, he gave me a list of surgeons to do a biopsy for me. I couldnt get an appointment before I moved. So when I got here, I went to the breast center of the nearest hospital, I had my original ultrasound screens and reports faxed over to them. The surgeon didnt even feel my breast!! he said he believed that the original breast center that did my first ultrasound labeled it a BIRADS 5 for insurance reasons.. and he said im too young to be worried. He also said that if I wanted to ease my mind he'll send me for another ultra sound. So I went, radiologist present. He said the shape was abnormal, (the sides were rigid, not smooth) but it was most likely a fibroadenoma. Well, I've had enough!!! I was scheduled yesterday for a consultation and next week I will finally be getting my biopsy. thank you for all your support everyone! i will definitely keep you guys posted on my results. it feels good to have a support system and makes this whole situation a little easier
Posts.Title: Should i be more assertive? jessicaaa LiLi1964
